title.narrative: Life-saving multisectoral GBV response services are accessible to women and girls and delivered through a survivor centred approach.

description.narrative:
The programmatic priorities of this UNFPA project are to prevent violence against women and girls and help victims and survivors to access multi-sectoral GBV response including medical care and family planning, psychosocial support, safe spaces, legal support and counselling. Together with UNWOMEN, UNFPA will be working towards two common outcomes with a focus on transforming harmful social norms and promoting the leadership of Women-led and rights Organizations. UNFPA is also working towards an agency-specific outcome in line with its mandate to provide quality multisectoral GBV response services to women and girls facing violence. . The Inter-Agency GBViE Minimum Standards, alongside the UNFPA Minimum Standards will be guiding implementation of this project which will also provide an opportunity to improve inclusion strategies for PwDs and strengthen AAPs mechanisms in the targeted locations.
This $17mil project targets 766,927 affected people with Protection/GBV engagement and 2,285 with Health.

owner-org.narrative: UN OCHA Central Emergency Response Fund (CERF)

organisation.narrative: UN Office for the Coordination of Humanitarian Affairs (OCHA)

mailing-address.narrative: United Nations Office for the Coordination of Humanitarian Affairs (OCHA), Central Emergency Response Fund (CERF), 2 United Nations Plaza (DC2), East 44th street (13th floor), United Nations, New York, USA

condition.narrative: CERF funding is based on an agreed proposal, including specific planned outcomes and outputs.

description.narrative: Lifesaving integrated GBV/SRH services are available and Women and girls access quality Clinical Management of Rape (CMR) and Intimate Partner Violence (IPV) health response services in Miranda, Bolivar and Apure.
Number of targeted healthcare facilities providing lifesaving quality Clinical Management of Rape (CMR) services
Number of targeted healthcare facilities supplied with Interagency Emergency Sexual and Reproductive Health (IARH) 3y 9 Kits

Number of health providers oriented on the Minimum Emergency Response Package (MISP) including the Guidance on CMR and IPV, for RH in Crisis including the Clinical Management of Rape (CMR) service as one of the main lifesaving integrated SRH/GBV intervention during emergencies and need to apply culturally sensitive approaches,
% of women and girls (disaggregated by age) who accessed CMR/IPV health services indicating satisfaction with services
% of women and girls who report that the CMR/IPV health services they accessed were delivered in accordance with their needs and preferences (disaggregated by type of gender and age)
Women and girls access quality PSS services, including CVA, in Táchira, Apure, Zulia, Bolivar and Miranda
# of women and girls who accessed quality, survivor-centered PSS, focused on healing, empowerment and recovery

GBV risk mitigation measures contribute to positive changes in reported perceptions of safety and risks.

The GBV Coordination group supports Palestine Cash Working Group to undertake GBV risk analysis to ensure that cash or voucher interventions do not exacerbate GBV.

A national joint action plan between the inter-agency Cash Working Group and GBV coordination group highlighting key joint activities to mitigate and prevent GBV risks in cash assistance to avoid doing harm or exacerbating GBV for beneficiaries of CVA is in place by year 2.
